message: I'm excited to offer you this incredible opportunity to purchase a unique product. I think you'll really love it. Would you like to make an offer on it?
I appreciate your offer, but $10,000 is a bit higher than I'm comfortable paying.  How about we split the difference and go with $9,000?
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, Bob. However, I'm not quite ready to meet you at $9,000. How about we meet in the middle at $10,500?
While I appreciate your willingness to compromise, $10,500 is still outside my budget. I'm willing to go up to $9,500. This would be a fair price for both of us and would help us reach an agreement.
I'm starting to think we're getting close, Bob. However, I'm still not willing to go below $11,000. How about we meet at $10,750?
I'm trying to be fair here, Alice. $10,750 is still a bit too high for me.  Let's meet in the middle at $10,000. This would allow us both to walk away satisfied.
I'm getting a bit concerned that we're getting too close to the deadline, Bob. I'm willing to make one more compromise. How about we meet at $10,250?

Alice, I understand we're running out of time, but $10,250 is still more than I can afford. To make this work, I'm willing to go up to $9,750. This is a fair price, and it allows us to close the deal.
I'm not willing to go any lower than $11,000, Bob. However, I'm willing to make one final compromise. How about we meet at $10,500, and I'll throw in some additional value to sweeten the deal?
